avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses. This applies in particular on rocky sunny slopes below approximately 3000 m, as well as on very steep north facing slopes below approximately 2300 m.
In some places moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers and reach very large size in isolated cases.
Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found especially on very steep slopes above approximately 2500 m.
Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started early and concluded timely.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Since Friday the weather has been exceptionally warm. These spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes and will soften during the day. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 2800 m.

tendency.comment: Gradual decrease in avalanche danger as the temperature drops. Tuesday: A little new snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses.
In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers and reach large size.
Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded very early.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Gradual increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Since Friday the weather has been exceptionally warm. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning, especially at low and intermediate altitudes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack below approximately 3000 m.
Above approximately 2200 m there is still a very large amount of snow.

tendency.comment: Gradual decrease in avalanche danger as the temperature drops.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses. This applies in particular on very steep sunny slopes below approximately 3000 m, as well as in steep rocky terrain.
In some places moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers and reach very large size in isolated cases.
Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded very early.

Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack below approximately 3000 m.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses. In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can slide on the ground.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Since Friday the weather has been exceptionally warm.
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack.
Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.

tendency.comment: Decrease in avalanche danger as the temperature drops.
